content: Organization **Energy Carta** is a [non-profit organization](/wiki/Non-profit_organization) founded in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) by a team of young adults. It promotes its cause by bringing stakeholders together to have discourse and provide solutions to the [climate change](/wiki/Climate_change) issues the [world](/wiki/World) faces. In particular, it seeks to promote interest amongst the [grassroots](/wiki/Grassroots) and [students](/wiki/Student) It was awarded the Special Mention Award of the 2013 Singapore Energy Award. ## Objectives ### Educate - To raise grassroots awareness, particularly amongst students, towards [clean technology](/wiki/Clean_technology) and the opportunities available in this emerging industry. - Highlight to the future leaders of the world the importance of economics, technology and policies in resolving [climate change](/wiki/Climate_change) issues. - Raising [environmental awareness](/wiki/Environmental_awareness) towards [global warming](/wiki/Global_warming) and climate change. ### Engage all stakeholders - [Stakeholders](/wiki/Project_stakeholder) include policymakers in [government](/wiki/Government), non-governmental [organizations](/wiki/Organizations), [institutes](/wiki/Institutes), [engineers](/wiki/Engineers), [entrepreneurs](/wiki/Entrepreneurs), corporate leaders, [academics](/wiki/Academic_staff), and student activists. - To engage these stakeholders to allow for [discourse](/wiki/Discourse) and creation of [economic](/wiki/Economic) opportunities. - Be the interface between the [student](/wiki/Student) population and the industry; realizing and publicizing the opportunities including [jobs](/wiki/Employment), [internships](/wiki/Internships), research projects, creation of startups etc. ### Focus on Asia - Highlight the economic potential, environmental urgency and possibilities within [Asia](/wiki/Asia), particularly favorable [policies](/wiki/Policies), emerging [markets](/wiki/Emerging_market) and [technology](/wiki/Technology). ## Team Energy Carta comprises over 30 student members with international and [leadership](/wiki/Leadership) experiences, with members from parts of the world such as [China](/wiki/China), [India](/wiki/India), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), [Bangladesh](/wiki/Bangladesh), Singapore and [Kenya](/wiki/Kenya). Some of the team has spent [time](/wiki/Time) working internationally in industry and studying in [universities](/wiki/Universities) across the [United States](/wiki/United_States), [Europe](/wiki/Europe), China and Singapore, including [Stanford University](/wiki/Stanford_University), [Wharton School](/wiki/Wharton_School) of the [University of Pennsylvania](/wiki/University_of_Pennsylvania), [Fudan University](/wiki/Fudan_University), the [Royal Institute of Technology](/wiki/Royal_Institute_of_Technology) (KTH) [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden) [KTH](/wiki/Royal_Institute_of_Technology) and the [National University of Singapore](/wiki/National_University_of_Singapore) (NUS). Many of them have led teams to organize international conferences and competitions including Harvard Project for Asian and International Relations, Start-Up@Singapore and BioBiz. ## Events Energy Carta events include: - Organizing an annual flagship [conference](/wiki/Convention_(meeting)) on [energy](/wiki/Energy) related issues, the first of which was a regional student conference in Oct 2008 focused on clean energy, targeting 200-300 students. - Smaller scale events such as panel sessions, lecture series, round table discussions and job fairs organized on a monthly basis for an audience of 50-100 students. - Collaborating with [university](/wiki/University) departments, [institutes](/wiki/Institute) and [companies](/wiki/Companies) in pursuing hands-on activities pertaining to [technology](/wiki/Technology), policy and [market research](/wiki/Market_research). - Sourcing for [internship](/wiki/Internship), job opportunities, commercial, [research](/wiki/Research) and technical projects for its members to engage in. - Embarking on energy efficiency initiatives within the school campus. - Official website
title: Energy Carta
